abstract: Michael Boyd will step down as artistic director at The Royal Shakespeare Company.
snippet: Michael Boyd will step down as artistic director at The Royal Shakespeare Company.
lead_paragraph: The Royal Shakespeare Company has announced that Michael Boyd will step down as artistic director next year, after more than a decade in the job, the BBC News reported. The executive director, Vikki Heywood, will leave her post at the same time. Under their supervision, the company recently completed a $177 million renovation of its theaters in Stratford-Upon-Avon, England, and a successful six-week run of performances in New York at the Park Avenue Armory. Mr. Boyd is also a chief architect of the World Shakespeare Festival, a celebration set to run from April to September 2012. Mr. Boyd said in a statement that it was "time for me to pass the challenges on to a new artistic director." The company is expected to announce a successor early next year.
